availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Henry Dunbar (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Sarah Dunbar. Married to Levina Dunbar. Father of George T. Dunbar. Student in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Served in the 20th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from January 6, 1862, to January 17, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 194B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 75.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 483A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
"Pioneer Citizen," The Madisonville Messenger (Madisonville, Ky.), November 22, 1930, p. 3.
